p:
According to the ODE shown in Figure 10a, B cells are only influenced by viruses: viruses support the production of B cells (rate term
m 1
V
), but the more B cells that are present, the more of them are destroyed by viruses again (term:
m 1
V B
). B cells influence only one other species, namely antibodies B, which they produce. Antibodies A influence only one other species, namely viruses, which are destroyed by this reaction at rate
Î¼ V A
. Antibodies in turn are influenced by B cells positively and by viruses negatively.
